description.full:
ofxCvHaarFinder allows you to check an image for a match to a Haar classifier. The Haar Classifier is a data file generated from a training process where an application is "taught" how to recognize something in different contexts. This can be things like recognizing whether a certain sound is a word being spoken by a user, whether a gesture is a certain shape, or, in the image shown below, whether a pattern of pixels constitute a face.

A very basic set-up of an application using ofxCvHaarFinder would look like so:

app::setup() {
   haarFinder.setup("haarcascade.xml"); // must be in /data/
}

app::update() {
   haarFinder.findHaarObjects(imageToExamine);
}

app::draw() {
  for(int i = 0; i < haarFinder.blobs.size(); i++) {
     ofDrawRectangle( haarFinder.blobs[i].boundingRect );
  }
}

methods.name: draw
methods.parameters: float x, float y
methods.desc: Draws any detected objects to the screen with a rectangle, like so:

methods.syntax: findHaarObjects(&, x, y, w, h, minWidth = 0, minHeight = 0)
methods.name: findHaarObjects
methods.parameters: const ofxCvGrayscaleImage &, int x, int y, int w, int h, int minWidth=0, int minHeight=0
methods.desc: Takes an input ofxCvGrayscaleImage object and allows you to set the minimum width and height of areas that should be returned and a region of interest as an ofRectangle that you would like to limit haar finding to.

methods.name: findHaarObjects
methods.parameters: const ofxCvGrayscaleImage &input, ofRectangle &roi, int minWidth=0, int minHeight=0
methods.desc:
Takes an input ofxCvGrayscaleImage object and allows you to set the minimum width and height of areas that should be returned and a region of interest as an ofRectangle that you would like to limit haar finding to.

colorImg.setFromPixels(vidGrabber.getPixels());
grayImage = colorImg; // convert our color image to a grayscale image

faceFinder.findHaarObjects(grayImage);

for(int i = 0; i < faceFinder.blobs.size(); i++) {
	ofRectangle roi = faceFinder.blobs[i].boundingRect;
	eyeFinder.findHaarObjects(grayImage, roi);
}

methods.name: findHaarObjects
methods.parameters: ofImage &input, int minWidth=0, int minHeight=0
methods.desc:
Takes an input ofImage object and allows you to set the minimum width and height of areas that should be returned.

camera.grabFrame();
if(camera.isFrameNew())
{
	img.setFromPixels(grab.getPixels());
	finder.findHaarObjects(img);
}

methods.name: findHaarObjects
methods.parameters: const ofxCvGrayscaleImage &input, int minWidth=0, int minHeight=0
methods.desc: Takes an input ofxCvGrayscaleImage object and allows you to set the minimum width and height of areas that should be returned.

methods.name: findHaarObjects
methods.parameters: ofPixels &input, int minWidth=0, int minHeight=0
methods.desc: Takes an input ofPixels object and allows you to set the minimum width and height of areas that should be returned.

methods.name: getHeight
methods.desc: Returns the height of the image area that is being examined.

methods.name: getWidth
methods.desc: Returns the width of the image area that is being examined.

methods.name: setNeighbors
methods.desc: Minimum number (minus 1) of neighbor rectangles that makes up an object. All the groups of a smaller number of rectangles than min_neighbors-1 are rejected. If min_neighbors is 0, the function does not any grouping at all and returns all the detected candidate rectangles, that might be useful if you want to do a customized grouping.

methods.name: setup
methods.desc: This loads a Haar cascade file into the finder. This needs to be done before the Haar finder can be used with images.

methods.name: blobs
methods.desc: Provides access to the all the blobs detected in the last run of findHaarObjects() via a vector<ofxCvBlob

page.document:
#class ofxCvHaarFinder

<!-- visible: True advanced: False istemplated: False _extends: _ -->

##InlineDescription

##Description

ofxCvHaarFinder allows you to check an image for a match to a Haar classifier. The Haar Classifier is a data file generated from a training process where an application is "taught" how to recognize something in different contexts. This can be things like recognizing whether a certain sound is a word being spoken by a user, whether a gesture is a certain shape, or, in the image shown below, whether a pattern of pixels constitute a face.

A very basic set-up of an application using ofxCvHaarFinder would look like so:

app::setup() {
   haarFinder.setup("haarcascade.xml"); // must be in /data/
}

app::update() {
   haarFinder.findHaarObjects(imageToExamine);
}

app::draw() {
  for(int i = 0; i < haarFinder.blobs.size(); i++) {
     ofDrawRectangle( haarFinder.blobs[i].boundingRect );
  }
}

##Methods

for(int i = 0; i < faceFinder.blobs.size(); i++) {

_inlined_description: _

_description: _

Minimum number (minus 1) of neighbor rectangles that makes up an object. All the groups of a smaller number of rectangles than min_neighbors-1 are rejected. If min_neighbors is 0, the function does not any grouping at all and returns all the detected candidate rectangles, that might be useful if you want to do a customized grouping.

page.raw:
#class ofxCvHaarFinder


<!--
_visible: True_
_advanced: False_
_istemplated: False_
_extends: _
-->

##InlineDescription






##Description

ofxCvHaarFinder allows you to check an image for a match to a Haar classifier. The Haar Classifier is a data file generated from a training process where an application is "taught" how to recognize something in different contexts. This can be things like recognizing whether a certain sound is a word being spoken by a user, whether a gesture is a certain shape, or, in the image shown below, whether a pattern of pixels constitute a face.

![face detection](face_detection.jpg "Face detection on a photograph")

A very basic set-up of an application using ofxCvHaarFinder would look like so:

~~~~{.cpp}
app::setup() {
   haarFinder.setup("haarcascade.xml"); // must be in /data/
}

app::update() {
   haarFinder.findHaarObjects(imageToExamine);
}

app::draw() {
  for(int i = 0; i < haarFinder.blobs.size(); i++) {
     ofDrawRectangle( haarFinder.blobs[i].boundingRect );
  }
}

~~~~





##Methods

-->

![Draw faces](draw_facedetection.jpg "Detecting faces.")

~~~~{.cpp}
colorImg.setFromPixels(vidGrabber.getPixels());
grayImage = colorImg; // convert our color image to a grayscale image

faceFinder.findHaarObjects(grayImage);

for(int i = 0; i < faceFinder.blobs.size(); i++) {
	ofRectangle roi = faceFinder.blobs[i].boundingRect;
	eyeFinder.findHaarObjects(grayImage, roi);
}
~~~~
